about.name: The following questions are from real DMV written tests. These are some of the actual permit questions you will face in California. Each permit practice test question has three answer choices. Select one answer for each question and select "grade this section." You can find this button at the bottom of the drivers license quiz.  For a complete list of questions and answers for California please visit https://cheat-sheets.dmv-written-test.com/en/california/car.

hasPart.name: A broken yellow centerline means that:

about.name: A broken yellow centerline means that:

hasPart.assesses: A broken yellow centerline means that: | A broken yellow centerline means that: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

comment.text: Passing is not permitted.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

comment.text: Passing on the right is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

suggestedAnswer.text: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

comment.text: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

acceptedAnswer.text: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

comment.text: Passing on the left is permitted when the way ahead is clear.

answerExplanation.text: A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

comment.text: A broken yellow centerline means that: | A broken yellow centerline means that a driver may cross the centerline to pass another vehicle on the left as long as there is no oncoming traffic. Drivers should never cross a solid yellow centerline in order to pass.

hasPart.name: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

about.name: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes?

hasPart.assesses: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? | Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

comment.text: You only need to turn and look over your right shoulder for lane changes to the right or left.

suggestedAnswer.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

comment.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

suggestedAnswer.text: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

comment.text: Vehicles with two outside mirrors do not have blind spots.

acceptedAnswer.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

comment.text: Look over your right shoulder for a right lane change and your left shoulder for a left lane change.

answerExplanation.text: Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

comment.text: Which of these statements is true about changing lanes? | Before changing lanes, signal, look in all your mirrors, and look over your left or right shoulder to make sure the lane next to you is clear. Looking over your shoulder is a way to check your blind spot to be sure there is no vehicle, motorcycle, or bicycle traffic in the next lane.

hasPart.name: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind?

about.name: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind?

hasPart.assesses: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind? | When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: When being closely followed by a tailgater, you should slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with them.

comment.text: Merging into another lane
Decreasing your following distance
Changing lanes frequently
Merging into another lane

answerExplanation.text: When being closely followed by a tailgater, you should slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with them.

comment.text: When being followed by a tailgater, which of the following will help you avoid being hit from behind? | When being closely followed by a tailgater, you should slow down gradually or merge into another lane to prevent a collision with them.

hasPart.name: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should:

about.name: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should:

hasPart.assesses: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should: | If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. Follow the officer's instructions.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stop until the light turns green.

comment.text: Stop until the light turns green.

suggestedAnswer.text: Go through the intersection without stopping.

comment.text: Go through the intersection without stopping.

suggestedAnswer.text: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.

comment.text: Come to a complete stop before proceeding.

acceptedAnswer.text: Go through the intersection without stopping.

comment.text: Go through the intersection without stopping.

answerExplanation.text: Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. Follow the officer's instructions.

comment.text: If you approach a traffic light with a red signal and a police officer directs you to go through the intersection without stopping, you should: | Instructions given by police officers directing traffic always override posted traffic signals and signs. hasPart.name: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol?

about.name: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol?

hasPart.assesses: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol? | Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: Factors affecting a person's absorption of alcohol include the person's weight, their biological sex, the amount of food in their digestive tract, and the number of alcoholic beverages they have consumed. The only thing to do to remove alcohol from a person's system is to wait.

comment.text: Weight
Height
Intelligence
Weight

answerExplanation.text: Factors affecting a person's absorption of alcohol include the person's weight, their biological sex, the amount of food in their digestive tract, and the number of alcoholic beverages they have consumed. The only thing to do to remove alcohol from a person's system is to wait.

comment.text: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol? | Factors affecting a person's absorption of alcohol include the person's weight, their biological sex, the amount of food in their digestive tract, and the number of alcoholic beverages they have consumed. The only thing to do to remove alcohol from a person's system is to wait.

educationalAlignment.targetDescription: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol? -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
educationalAlignment.targetName: Which of the following factors affect an individual's absorption of alcohol?

hasPart.name: This white sign means:
hasPart.assesses: This white sign means: | This white sign means: -  Real 2025 DMV Questions
hasPart.text: A white, rectangular sign indicates that you must obey important rules. This sign means that drivers should allow the left lane to remain open, when possible, for passing and for faster traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: You should slow down and move to the right lane.

comment.text: You should slow down and move to the right lane.

suggestedAnswer.text: Stay in the right lane if you are driving more slowly than other traffic.

comment.text: Stay in the right lane if you are driving more slowly than other traffic.

suggestedAnswer.text: Slower traffic must exit on the right.

comment.text: Slower traffic must exit on the right.

acceptedAnswer.text: Stay in the right lane if you are driving more slowly than other traffic.

comment.text: Stay in the right lane if you are driving more slowly than other traffic.

answerExplanation.text: A white, rectangular sign indicates that you must obey important rules. This sign means that drivers should allow the left lane to remain open, when possible, for passing and for faster traffic.

comment.text: This white sign means: | A white, rectangular sign indicates that you must obey important rules. This sign means that drivers should allow the left lane to remain open, when possible, for passing and for faster traffic.
